{{Infobox Network Adapter |image1 = |image1_size = |caption = RangeBooster N USB Adapter |caption2 = |pp = |sp = http://support.dlink.com/ProductInfo.aspx?m=DWA-140 |dl = |wikidevi = D-Link_DWA-140_rev_B3 |wikipedia = |brand = D-Link |model = DWA-140 |submodelappend = |submodel = |revision = B3 |subrevision = |model_part_num = |page_start_date = September 10, 2011 |page_start_origon = https://wikidevi.com/wiki/D-Link_DWA-140_rev_B3 |sernum = |wlclass = N300 |series = DWA-140 |if = USB |if_bus_version = 2.0 |ifconnector = Male A |formfactor = dongle |vendor_id = 2001 |device_id = 3c15 |subvendor_id = |subdevice_id = |id_string = |windosid = |fcc_id = KA2WA140B3 |icid = |boardid = |ecc_id = |oui = 84:C9:B2 |chip1 = Ralink;RT5372; |chip2 = |chip3 = |chip4 = |antconn = |antenna = |txchains = 2 |rxchains = 2 |sstreams = 2 |wirelessstand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |802.11n = 300 |802.11g = 54 |802.11b = 11 |wififreq = 2.4 |receive_sens = |transmit_power = |linuxdriv = |windriv = |is_manuf = No |manuf = Alpha Networks |manuf_model = WUS-N24 |manuf_rev = |addchip = |flags = |802dot11_protocols = bgn |accessible_UART = No |accessible_JTAG = |category = |availability = |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 08/02/2011 |estreldate = |estprice = |upc = |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |country = China |powledcolor = |connactled = |spdledcolor = |leddupcolor = |dimmin = |weight = }}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== "8WUSN24..1A1G" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos. The USB ID previously used in this entry (07d1:3c15) was from the DWA-140 rev B drivers on the D-Link website. The chip used in this device appears to be RT5372 ([http://rt2x00.serialmonkey.com/phpBB/viewtopic.php?f=5&t=6202 On the rt2x00.serialmonkey.com forums]). 
[ 9668.744618] phy0 -> rt2x00_set_chip: Info - Chipset detected - rt: 5392, rf: 000f, rev: 0222.
